pull.title: Revert "build: Fix regression in "ARMv8 CRC32 intrinsics" test"

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29226).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
We could alternatively add a suppression but I prefer reverting unless someone can explain how this is not an actual bug.

> We could alternatively add a suppression but I prefer reverting unless someone can explain how this is not an actual bug.

Assuming that this is a bug, disabling the buggy feature should be documented properly, no?

events.message:
Revert "build: Fix regression in "ARMv8 CRC32 intrinsics" test"

This reverts commit 228d6a2969e4fcee573c9df7aad31550eab9c8d4.

events.body: Added documentation about the potential bug
